topics.body:
"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f0ce3e63687277ed531100#post_54f0ce3e63687277ed531100
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f0cf036368724f9fd51600#post_54f0cf036368724f9fd51600
A dress that some people say is white and gold but others believe looks blue and black

I already made a solution explaining why both are correct answers

"@EHAN":/838456#comment_54f0a76b6368723645e20b00
[bq="EHAN"]Ok about the dress thing, and I hate to bring it up again

But I figured out the solution

The image's color balance was screwed up, and in the image the dress appears white/gold
!http://static6.businessinsider.com/image/54efd931eab8ea4e58d8fa89-639-479/white-gold-blue-black-dress.jpeg!

But the actual dress was found on Amazon, and it's black/blue
!http://d3819ii77zvwic.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/black-and-blue-or-gold-and-white-dress-amazon-review-615x342.jpg!
So in conclusion: the dress IS in fact black/blue, but the image's color balance makes it look white/gold

Both sides are technically correct here, so don't you dare try to argue anymore[/bq]
